IRS990.MissionDescription: Providing exceptional educational services in a private Baptist university environment.
IRS990.Description: Program service activity, tuition and fees,contribute importanty to the University's exempt purposes by providing educational services to students at less than the aggregate cost of these services. Such activity is the primary corporate purpose for which the University was formed. Athletics, sales and services and all auxiliary enterprises are essential components of the University's primary exempt purpose of providing educational service. Since these business activities are substantially related and contribute importantly to the accomplishment of the University's exempt purposes, the net income is not required to be reported on Form 990T.

OtherAssets.Description: Note receivable-Cumberland Wellness Investment Fund, LLC

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The museum collections are on display at the Cumberland Inn and are there for educational purposes.
Investment income-Cumberland Wellness Properties, Inc.: 33. Lease income: 190000.
Depreciation-Cumberland Wellness Properties, Inc.: 324681. Interest-Cumberland Wellness Properties, Inc.: 190000.
Loan cancellations and loss provisions: 0. Present value adjustment to annuities payable: 0. Lease expense to Cumberland Wellness Properties, Inc.: 0.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: The University's nondiscriminatory policy is published in the student handbook, distributed to students at the beginning of each school year.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: The University receives financial assistance from governmental agencies that it passes on to its students in the form of scholarships.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Housing allowance for the President of the University of $4,500 is included in his taxable compensation.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The 990 is reviewed by the audit and finance committee before filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Disclosure forms are distributed annually to all Board of Trustees and to all faculty and staff.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The President of the University is reviewed annually by the personnel committee of the Board of Trustees which recommend the compensation and benefit levels to the full Board. All management personnel are reviewed by the President of the University.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The University would provide its governing documents, conflict of interest policy and their financial statements available to anyone who requested the documents.
